newsitem.title: BARBADOS: CRICKET-WEST INDIES WIN TOSS, PUT INDIA IN TO BAT.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-WEST INDIES WIN TOSS, PUT INDIA IN TO BAT.

text.p: West Indies won the toss and put India in to bat in the fourth and final one-day international at the Kensington Oval on Saturday.
Both teams were unchanged from the third game in Kingstown, St Vincent, won by West Indies by 18 runs to give them a 2-1 series lead.
West Indies - Shivnarine Chanderpaul, Stuart Williams, Brian Lara, Carl Hooper, Jimmy Adams, Roland Holder, Courtney Browne, Ottis Gibson, Curtly Ambrose, Franklyn Rose, Courtney Walsh (captain).
India - Sachin Tendulkar (captain), Saurav Ganguly, Rahul Dravid, Mohammad Azharuddin, Ajay Jadeja, Robin Singh, Noel David, Syed Karim, Anil Kumble, Abey Kuruvilla, Venkatesh Prasad.
